Posted By: lyle685 (2/27/2011 2:24:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yes, she should work with Exalted. If she attacks alone, both the exalted trigger and her soldier-spawning trigger go on the stack. She gets an exalted buff, then some soldiers show up and are attacking.  
  
It should still work even if you resolve the abilities in the opposite order and have the soldiers come out first. The soldier tokens will have a property "attacking" but they did not actually "attack"(meaning 'were declared as attackers'), so Hero of Bladehold did "attack alone" even if reinforcements showed up. And Exalted only cares about the state of your creatures when it triggers anyway, not when it resolves. So yeah, swing away.
posts.html:
Yes, she should work with Exalted. If she attacks alone, both the exalted trigger and her soldier-spawning trigger go on the stack. She gets an exalted buff, then some soldiers show up and are attacking.

It should still work even if you resolve the abilities in the opposite order and have the soldiers come out first. The soldier tokens will have a property "attacking" but they did not actually "attack"(meaning 'were declared as attackers'), so Hero of Bladehold did "attack alone" even if reinforcements showed up. And Exalted only cares about the state of your creatures when it triggers anyway, not when it resolves. So yeah, swing away.

posts.post_content:
@superwill:  
  
You kinda have the right idea. If you do what you said and [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) after she makes the tokens, then the tokens and the [White Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Knight)s become her, and then nothing happens because the attack triggers have already passed. you would be swinging for at least 15 damage though. (not sure about the layering with battle cry and changing the creatures.)   
  
But, if you [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) before attacking though, the knights also become her, and you get 6 different 4/1 soldiers and 3 5/4's, and that's pretty nuts-oh. 35 damage seems pretty gewd to me.   
  
If you have another [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) in hand next turn, well, then...... wow.

Posted By: ajpinton (1/31/2011 4:23:56 PM)

posts.post_content:
I think the reason why she isn't wearing much isn't because of fanservice, but rather because the Auriok don't really wear that much--if you look at [Accorder Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Accorder Paladin), or the people on [Frantic Salvage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frantic Salvage) from the same set, they're not wearing full armor, or even shirts.   
  
As for her as a card, her abilities are quite good--when she attacks, just by herself she's basically attacking with seven points of damage. Now imagine her with [Honor of the Pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor of the Pure) of [True Conviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=True Conviction) (or worse, both--that could kill a player if they, for some inexplicable reason, don't block). She's an amazing card with so much potential.
posts.html:
I think the reason why she isn't wearing much isn't because of fanservice, but rather because the Auriok don't really wear that much--if you look at Accorder Paladin, or the people on Frantic Salvage from the same set, they're not wearing full armor, or even shirts.

As for her as a card, her abilities are quite good--when she attacks, just by herself she's basically attacking with seven points of damage. Now imagine her with Honor of the Pure of True Conviction (or worse, both--that could kill a player if they, for some inexplicable reason, don't block). She's an amazing card with so much potential.

posts.post_content:
hero of Hero of Bladehold damage = 3x\*\*2 + 4x   
where x is equal to the number of hero's you are swinging with assuming no other creatures are around  
yeah 7,20,39 that's crazy.

posts.post_content: It's too bad the 1/1s don't come into play as *Human* Soldiers. With Innistrad right around the corner, these tokens having the subtype **Human** would really benefit the tribal aspect of Human decks, which I'm hoping to build. I mean think about it: She comes into play. Then as she attacks, she inspires (whether it be with a rally cry or her lady-parts) other assumingly humans (seeing as Aurioks are predominantly humans) to charge into battle with her. They're apparently raceless, faceless, subtype-less blobs wearing soldier armor (but then again they'd probably get the creature subtype *Blob Soldier*). WHY MUST A SLIGHT MISSTEP IN DEVELOPMENT CAUSE MY FUTURE HUMAN DECK TO BE NOT AS AMAZING AS IT COULD BE. WHHYYYYYY
